intro: Sedum jaliscanum subsp. angustifolium, commonly known as narrowleaf stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to Mexico. It features fleshy, narrow leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or orange during the summer months. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it suitable for rock gardens or xeriscaping. Its hardy nature allows it to survive in a variety of environmental conditions.
